climbs.name: Montclair
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Cyndie Bransford, Dave, Kate Duke

content.description: Climb thin edges past a bulge to a high first bolt. Crux continues until you pass the second bolt and reach large holds. Continue up past a third bolt and either run it out to the anchor on easy territory or place some stoppers along the way.
content.protection: Three button head bolts and a set of stoppers to a bolted anchor.
content.location: Located on the north face it starts left of a giant cats claw below the high first bolt. Rap from slings on bolts.

climbs.name: The Greedy Goat
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Dwain Warren

content.description:
Climb to the top of a boulder leaning against the main face and then continue up and right to a high first bolt with a bad landing. Higher, interesting moves up steep patina edges lead to an anchor below a roof. Two stars out of five.

Due to the height of the first bolt, combined with the bad landing, it's advised to stick clip it or perhaps even lean across from an adjacent boulder.
content.location:
West face of Demon Dome in a brushy alcove and left of

Doin' Some Damage

on the main portion of the dome. Approach through a slot then tunnel up and under to the base.

content.description:
This route climbs an obvious left-slanting crack which start partway up the face.

Start near a greenish patch of rock and climb scabby face up and right past a hueco to gain the base of the crack. Plug some gear and dive in the awkward flare with a hand crack in the back. Gear belay and walk off. One star out of five.
content.location: Southwest side of Demon Dome on a small block

climbs.name: Bee War
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Cyndie Bransford, Dave, Kate Duke

content.description: Climb up a heavily plated face with many knobs and slots for pro. About 3/4 of the way up head right to better holds and lower angle until you reach the summit.
content.protection: Set of nuts, slings for knobs, and small cams to .4. There is a sling bolted rap to the left but the bolted anchor for this climb is hidden from view and located up and over the headwall of the summit.
content.location: Furthest right climb of the north face. Look for numerous plats and knobs on the right side.
